to banish motorcars and typewriters or
even the dreadful handwriting anyone who
can fathom the way of the world
knows that all these things had to come
and are quite legitimate what I now say
must not be taken as meaning that they
should be abolished I refer to the
attention and care that is given to them
they had to come we must accept them
even as we must accept day and night but
the enthusiasm for these things may lead
to a one-sided attitude in persons who
have a strong leaning to the material
world all that is entering the world in
this way making such a dreadful headway
in the illegible handwriting
and such a dreadful hubbub in the type
writing machines and which rushes so
terribly through the world in the
motorcars must be counterbalanced by a
strong penetration into spiritual
knowledge spiritual feeling and
spiritual willing if man is to develop
in a healthy way there should be no
question of fighting the material but
rather learning to know it in its true
reality of understanding it but also of
seeing how necessary it is that what
will otherwise crush humanity out of
physical existence should be
counterbalanced by strong spirituality
then through the swing of the pendulum
between typewriters and motor cars on
the one hand and on the other the
imaginations the insight into the
spiritual world created as a result of
the world of spiritual science the
healthy development of humanity may be
promoted instead of being damaged this
is what I had especially to say in
Penman ma but this is a place where on
the one hand such legacies still remain
from the times of the old druids as the
imaginations which as I described remain
stationary along the other one
experiences how enormously these
stationary imaginations
are disturbed by the atmosphere of the
rushing motorcars
